properties.areaDesc: St. Clair; Morgan; Cedar; Crawford; Bourbon; Barton; Benton; Vernon
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 9 at 3:58PM CST until January 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Springfield MO
properties.description:
* TIMING...A wintry mix of freezing rain, sleet, and snow Friday
night will turn to all snow Saturday morning, then taper off in
the afternoon. Three to four inches of snow and around a tenth
of an inch of ice accumulation are expected.

* MAIN IMPACT...The combination of snow and ice will have the
potential to make travel hazardous. Temperatures will fall
into the 20s during this time. Roads will become slick. A
glaze of ice will make other surfaces slick, especially
elevated bridges and decks.

* OTHER IMPACTS...Some travel impacts will be possible. A glaze
of ice will may also make slip and fall accidents more common.
North wind gusts of 30 mph will also occur during this time.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Storm Watch means there is a potential for significant
snow, sleet, or ice accumulations that may impact travel.
Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON
